title: Executive Order 5770-Port Everglades, Florida Designated a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the act of Congress approved August 1, 1914 (U.S. Code, title 19, sec. 2), Port Everglades, Fla., is hereby designated a customs port of entry in Customs Collection District No. 18 (Florida) with headquarters at Tampa, Fla., effective January 1, 1932.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5770-Port Everglades, Florida Designated a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361332
